key_points: Captain Krishnan Kanthavel and his crew are pictured for the first time since the Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal.
The Ever Given was stuck in the Suez Canal, causing significant global trade disruption for six days.
The incident caused global trade delays and is estimated to have cost world trade about £7 billion a day.
More than 400 ships were held up due to the blockage of the canal.
A $1 billion compensation deal was negotiated between the Ever Given's owners and the Suez Canal Authority.
The blockage also led to Egypt losing $15 million in transit fees each day.
The Ever Given was held in the Great Bitter Lake for four months before being released.
The ship is carrying goods worth over £650 million, some of which may have perished, including food items.
Acknowledgment of the crew's hard work and professionalism from the ship's owner, Shoei Kisen Kaisha Ltd, and the National Union of Seafarers of India.
Investigations into the incident have begun, with no official outcome announced yet. Egypt plans to widen and deepen the canal section and upgrade its rescue fleet.
spokespersons: Capt Krishnan Kanthavel (captain of the Ever Given)
